register.description: This is the standard TI peripheral ID register that exists at address 0 in the peripheral space

bitfield.description: PID scheme
PID bu identifier
PID function identifier
PID RTL version number
PID Major revision number
PID custom
PID Minor revision number

register.description: This register controls the overall behavior of the rate limiter module

bitfield.description: Enable the region filter, which will only apply the bandwith and transaction limits to the configured address regions
Enable limiting maximum outstanding write transactions
Enable limiting maximum outstanding read transactions
Enable write bandwidth limiting
Enable read bandwidth limiting

register.description: Read Bandwidth Committed Information Rate

bitfield.description: Committed Information Rate

register.description: Read Bandwidth Peak Information Rate

bitfield.description: Peak Information Rate

register.description: Read Bandwidth Burst Offset

bitfield.description: Burst Offset - the number of bytes before the Committed Information Rate is applied at startup or after a period of inactivity. Peak Information Rate will still apply

register.description: Read Bandwidth State machine information. Primarly for verification purposes

bitfield.description: Read Bandwidth three-color marker output from rategen submodule

register.description: Read Bandwidth Statistics Control Register

bitfield.description: Statistics window size. This cannot be set to 0. If 16'd0 is written, it will be set to the reset value of 16'd1024
Statistics overflow error
Clear statistics data. Resets statistics counters at 0
Enable read bandwidth statistics

register.description: A statistics threshold separate from the CIR and PIR

bitfield.description: Read bandwidth stats threshold in bytes. Note that this is total bytes, unlike CIR and PIR. CIR and PIR are based on a rolling window, and the statistics threshold is based on a fixed window. This will still take into account DDR bytes used, so can be compared to CIR and PIR directly if the bandwidths are converted via the equations for CIR and PIR. The threshold bandwidth is programmed here as bytes per window

register.description: Read Bandwidth Statistics - Window Count

bitfield.description: Read bandwidth window count - the number of windows elapsed since statistics collection began

register.description: Read Bandwidth Statistics - CIR Count

bitfield.description: The total number of statistics windows in which Read Commit Information Rate occurred. Note that if PIR is set to a lower value than CIR or if the burst offset feature is used, this will also count times that PIR is reached.

register.description: Read Bandwidth Statistics - PIR Count

bitfield.description: The total number of statistics windows in which Read Peak Information Rate occurred

register.description: Read Bandwidth Statistics - Threshold Count

bitfield.description: The total number of statistics windows in which Read bytes transferred exceeded the statistics threshold

register.description: The maximum number of bytes seen in a single statitsics window. This can be compared with the window size to calculate the maximum bandwidth seen

bitfield.description: Max number of bytes in a single window. This number accounts for DDR bandwidth consumed, not simply the accumulation of the packet bytecnt values across a window. The max bandwidth calculation is the total bytes value in this MMR divided by the windows size in RD_BW_STATS.window and multiplied with the interface frequency: RD_BYTES_MAX * FREQ / RD_BW_STATS.window

register.description: Write Bandwidth Committed Information Rate

bitfield.description: Committed Information Rate

register.description: Write Bandwidth Peak Information Rate

bitfield.description: Peak Information Rate

register.description: Write Bandwidth Burst Offset

bitfield.description: Burst Offset - the number of bytes before the Committed Information Rate is applied at startup or after a period of inactivity. Peak Information Rate will still apply

register.description: Write Bandwidth State machine information. Primarly for verification purposes

bitfield.description: Write Bandwidth three-color marker output from rategen submodule

register.description: Write Bandwidth Statistics Control Register

bitfield.description: Statistics window size. This cannot be set to 0. If 16'd0 is written, it will be set to the reset value of 16'd1024
Statistics overflow error
Clear statistics data. Resets statistics counters at 0
Enable write bandwidth statistics

register.description: A statistics threshold separate from the CIR and PIR

bitfield.description: Write bandwidth stats threshold in bytes. Note that this is total bytes, unlike CIR and PIR. CIR and PIR are based on a rolling window, and the statistics threshold is based on a fixed window. This will still take into account DDR bytes used, so can be compared to CIR and PIR directly if the bandwidths are converted via the equations for CIR and PIR. The threshold bandwidth is programmed here as bytes per window

register.description: Write Bandwidth Statistics - Window Count

bitfield.description: Write bandwidth window count - the number of windows elapsed since statistics collection began

register.description: Write Bandwidth Statistics - CIR Count

bitfield.description: The total number of statistics windows in which Write Commit Information Rate occurred. Note that if PIR is set to a lower value than CIR or if the burst offset feature is used, this will also count times that PIR is reached.

register.description: Write Bandwidth Statistics - PIR Count

bitfield.description: The total number of statistics windows in which Write Peak Information Rate occurred

register.description: Write Bandwidth Statistics - Threshold Count

bitfield.description: The total number of statistics windows in which Write bytes transferred exceeded the statistics threshold

register.description: The maximum number of bytes seen in a single statitsics window. This can be compared with the window size to calculate the maximum bandwidth seen

bitfield.description: Max number of bytes in a single window. This number accounts for DDR bandwidth consumed, not simply the accumulation of the packet bytecnt values across a window. The max bandwidth calculation is the total bytes value in this MMR divided by the windows size in WR_BW_STATS.window and multiplied with the interface frequency: WR_BYTES_MAX * FREQ / WR_BW_STATS.window

register.description: The maximum number of outstanding read transactions the rate limiter will allow

bitfield.description: The maximum number of outstanding read transactions allowed. NOTE: This cannot be programmed to a zero. If a zero is written, it will default to the reset value of 16'd64, as a limit of zero outstanding transactions would hang the interface.

register.description: Read Transaction State machine information. Primarly for verification purposes

bitfield.description: Read transaction scoreboard occupancy

register.description: Read Transaction Stats Control Register

bitfield.description: Statistics window size. This cannot be set to 0. If 16'd0 is written, it will be set to the reset value of 16'd1024
Statistics overflow error
Clear statistics data. Resets statistics counters at 0
Enable read transaction statistics

register.description: A statistics threshold separate from the read transaction limit

bitfield.description: Read transaction statistics threshold. The threshold can be set to any value, though it will saturate at the outstanding transaction limit if it is set to a value greater than the programmed outstanding read transaction limit

register.description: Read Transaction Statistics - Window Count

bitfield.description: Read transaction window count - the number of windows elapsed since statistics collection began

register.description: Read Transaction Statistics - number of windows in which the outstanding transaction limit was reached

bitfield.description: The number of statistics windows in which the outstanding read transaction limit was reached

register.description: Read Transaction Statistics - number of windows in which the statistics threshold was reached

bitfield.description: The number of statistics windows in which the number of outstanding read transactions was greater than or equal to the threshold in RD_TXN_STATS_THRSHLD

register.description: Read Transaction Statistics - Cycles at Outstanding Read Transactions Limit

bitfield.description: The total number of cycles with the read transactions outstanding at the programmed limit since statistics collection began

register.description: Read Transaction Statistics - Cycles at the Statistics Threshold

bitfield.description: The total number of cycles with read transactions outstanding greater than or equal to the statistics threshold in RD_TXN_STATS_THRSHLD since statistics collection began

register.description: Read Transaction Statistics - Max Observed Outstanding Read Transactions

bitfield.description: The maximum outstanding read transactions at any point in time, regardless of the programmed limit

register.description: The maximum number of outstanding write transactions the rate limiter will allow

bitfield.description: The maximum number of outstanding write transactions allowed. NOTE: This cannot be programmed to a zero. If a zero is written, it will default to the reset value of 16'd64, as a limit of zero outstanding transactions would hang the interface.

register.description: Write Transaction State machine information. Primarly for verification purposes

bitfield.description: Write transaction scoreboard occupancy

register.description: Write Transaction Stats Control Register

bitfield.description: Statistics window size. This cannot be set to 0. If 16'd0 is written, it will be set to the reset value of 16'd1024
Statistics overflow error
Clear statistics data. Resets statistics counters at 0
Enable write transaction statistics

register.description: A statistics threshold separate from the write transaction limit

bitfield.description: Write transaction statistics threshold. The threshold can be set to any value, though it will saturate at the outstanding transaction limit if it is set to a value greater than the programmed outstanding write transaction limit

register.description: Write Transaction Statistics - Window Count

bitfield.description: Write transaction window count - the number of windows elapsed since statistics collection began

register.description: Write Transaction Statistics - number of windows in which the outstanding transaction limit was reached

bitfield.description: The number of statistics windows in which the outstanding write transaction limit was reached

register.description: Write Transaction Statistics - number of windows in which the statistics threshold was reached

bitfield.description: The number of statistics windows in which the number of outstanding write transactions was greater than or equal to the threshold in WR_TXN_STATS_THRSHLD

register.description: Write Transaction Statistics - Cycles at Outstanding Write Transactions Limit

bitfield.description: The total number of cycles with the write transactions outstanding at the programmed limit since statistics collection began

register.description: Write Transaction Statistics - Cycles at the Statistics Threshold

bitfield.description: The total number of cycles with write transactions outstanding greater than or equal to the statistics threshold in WR_TXN_STATS_THRSHLD since statistics collection began

register.description: Write Transaction Statistics - Max Observed Outstanding Write Transactions

bitfield.description: The maximum outstanding write transactions at any point in time, regardless of the programmed limit
